text: Its better to die at your home rather than going to the hospital. My wife was having breathing problem due to muscle pull at her right back. Took her to the hospital, all they did was give 5 pain killers (2 at first and 3 @after an hour).   They said the longest wait time is going to be 4 hrs, But I waited 12 hrs , 10 pm to 10 am. Flys were moving around me and it was tough to wait in the waiting room since I was not the only person waiting. I tried to make them understand that she cannot breathe properly all the did was offer us warm blanket. After 12 hrs of wait they called us. We went inside and waited for 2 more hours, it might have been more if I didn't keep on pushing them. The end results? Doctor took an X ray and said everything is fine , she needs to rest and take painkillers. So , we have waited for 14 hrs for this? All we needed to know was take painkillers and rest at home.  We could have slept properly at our home , rather than sitting at a chair and having a backpain overnight.I became sick as well after this wait. This was my first time visiting any hospital in my 5years I have lived here. I hope , I never have to see that place again.  So called urgent care, its a shame

November 26,2024 I attended Victoria Hospital with a infection.. I only waited 4 hours to be seen  which is excellent in this day and age of health care in Manitoba. During this 4 hours I received excellent care from Registration,Triage and Lab personnel. I also observed the excellent care and concern the security team provided to the patients and families and to a person presenting problems .
Once I was taken in for care I received excellent care from the Nurse Practitioner, Doctor, RN’s, HCA’s, X-ray staff. I also noted the care of cleaning staff in the unit
I hope that this review is seen by all your personal with my sincere thank you.
My only area of concern was the waiting room which needed attention due to people vomitimg om furniture and floor and was not cleaned up during my 4 hours in the waiting room.
I would recommend Victoria Urgent Care to everyone. Please do not blame the staff for long waits. Put the onus on your government!
The nurses were amazing. Making sure I was comfortable Well I had my surgery. So satisfied with the care I received from this hospital.

I am extremely grateful to the doctors and nurses that really saved my life . I encountered a guy when the ambulance came that a little bit disappointed me with his lack of ability to understand my situation, but then when I got there in the emergency and they saw my face they took me seriously and straight up all night didn’t leave my side until they made sure I have got 4 bags of blood transfusions to be able to survive , as I had lost to that point 75% of my blood through bleeding. I was told I have a big fibroid inside my uterus , 13 cm and they helped me all through the night! I couldn’t ask for better people. They deserve more respect and more money than they get . These people are truly different breed than anyone else ! Thank you so very much guys ! Deeply appreciated!❤️❤️❤️❤️

excellent and exceptional care.  i was in day surgery.   a big surgery as well.   i felt safe and and supported and well cared for.   honestly… everything was done professionally.   my surgeon Dr Awadella and his team and just awesome .   The Victoria Hospital staff right from the meet at the front door , to admitting , to all the HCAs , the nurses and all of the docs , a huge thank you.

This place should not even be called Urgent Care or even a hospital. Firstly, awhile back I went there with severe kidney pain to the point of where I had to lie down on the floor for some comfort and by that time we’ve already been waiting hours. When I was finally seen, a male nurse came in and he was so grumpy and in a way uninterested in caring for me. He gave me a urine sample bottle, I gave my sample which they lost, I have no clue how but they lost it. I was finally seen by the doctor and was told I was fine even though I was profusely sweating from holding in the pain. Secondly, an ambulance took my mother to Urgent care at around 2am, she was having pretty bad coughing fit and she fought through the severe pain she had in her whole stomach area and between the ribs. She waited for almost 13 hours and she was the last patient to be seen. How ridiculous is that? Do they not care? I then decided to sign her out seeing that she will not be seen for more hours to come. That is the last time we will ever go to Vic

Ultrasound appointment not honored. I was scheduled an ultrasound in May as a post camcer operative review. My appointment was yesterday where I took time off work, drove across town, paid for parking and only to be told that I missed my appointment earlier in the week. I explained that my appointment was today and coordinated by my surgeon who is meeting with me with next step results in 2 weeks time. The clerk walked away only to return to say again that my appointment was on Monday and I was a no show. I was in shock and he turned me away. They would not honor my appointment. It was a horrible way to be treated and I am disgusted by the response of this employee and inability to accommodate a person who was not notified of any changes.

Thank you Dr. Nobby Woo and his team at the Victoria Hospital.
I had surgery on September 23/2024. The care and professionalism was exemplary. I hope every patient has the same experience.
Alan

Was brought in by ambulance as I was having a mental health crisis. First of all the waiting room was packed and someone who experiences high anxiety when there is larg crowds I was unable to sit in the waiting room. And preferred to sit in an area with less people and a lot more quieter.
I was not doing well that particular night and was highly suicidal. I just needed some help.
I understand I had to wait my turn like everyone else. What was so disappointing was one particular nurse from the mental health accessment unit, came out loudly and told me I had two options, sit in the over packed waiting room or send me home. I explained my anxiety to sitting in a packed waiting room and expressed I was suicidal.
I have been numerous times to the mental health assessment unit and have felt compassion, patience, and understanding from certain nurses. But that night was completely disappointing. Not only did I have everyone in the waiting room hear my struggles but having a professional mental health provider tell me I manipulate the nurses, which is false, but they also loudly recap previous visits so everyone can hear my personal struggles. My personal imformation. Very unprofessional. The nurse gave me two options remember I'm highly suicidal and needed a safe place at that moment. 1.  I sit in the waiting room which I couldn't do or they send me home. I expressed to the nurse how I was feeling unsafe to leave and was highly suicidal.  The nurse response "well that's your choice if you harmed yourself".  I couldn't believe the treatment I received from that particular nurse.
No one should be judged by past experiences or even be treated because of their mental health diagnosis but to be treated with compassion, understanding, patience and most of all as a human being.
I've lost all trust in the mental health assessment unit staff and will never go back. Luckily, I survived that night but came very close to ending it. What I don't understand is why would anyone especially mental health professionals send someone home when that individual is a high risk to hurt themselves or even die. No one should feel the way I felt and experienced that night because it would be such a tragedy if someone lost their life to suicide because they were sent home when all they needed was a safe place and some compassionate help.

Took my 14 year old son here today for lower abdomen pain and testicular pain, waited 6 hours for a doctor to only push on his tummy then say they cannot do ultrasounds or ct scan on children under 16. The doctor was going to send us home with no help at all. If you have an age restriction you should properly post it and have the desk tell you to go somewhere else cause you cannot properly treat or diagnose a child with pain under 16. I had to yell at the doctor and demand a scan requisition form to at least be sent to children’s hospital for a call back appt.

I am posting this review using my husband's account as you could not see it if I did not.  (Donna Adams)

Red Alert.  There has been an "outbreak" on 4 South.

The information has not been shared publicly with those required to attend that hospital.  Only a sign at the first floor elevators alerts one that the possible threat of exposure at that hospital exists. Upon entering there is no requirement to wear a mask. The staff don't.  The visitors don't.  The patients don't.  And because we don't have memories like sieves,  we still do - wear a mask and on occasion use the professional quality hand sanitizer provided by the publicly funded health care facility  You?  Little sympathy for those not living in the world we do.  Containing the spread of a virus not this country's strength.  Nor are adequate resources to assist those who through no fault of their own are infected.

My beloved husband and bff of 35 years who is 74 years of age and just diagnosed with prostate cancer (apparently easy to treat successfully at this moment in time) knows how to protect himself to the extent that he can but clearly cannot protect himself from those who care little about his life.

Deja vu.

Neither could my mother, the victim of an unnecessary medical procedure (treatment for stage 1 cancer of the uterus that had not metastasized) that forced her into the health care system during Covid because of vaginal hemorrhaging that could have caused her death.

This test that my husband was scheduled for very suddenly and unaware for what reason, related to what health problem? It was a scan of his upper body and his pelvis.  The scan of his lower body performed there approximately 2 weeks ago.  I did not attend with him the first time.  No bus fare to get there.

off the chart angry.  And very interesting reading material related to seniors while waiting.   Not Zoomer magazine I hope.

BTW is it normal/natural to suffer the constant pain associated with endometriosis/itis because there is no treatment that is effective.  I suffer from it.  No genetic predisposition to any of these diseases.

This is the healthcare facility that one is transported to by a paramedic as it is the catchment area defined by whoever.  I have attended to this facility many times.  The last time for a fractured skapula that was identified as related to a fracture of the sacroiliac joint by the Xray techician,  Thank God for the quick thinking Emerg doctor that thought my arm should be in a sling.  Not my ass.

Maybe finally "theirs" should be. Always ask others for their opinion only if you want to listen.  Anyone else think so?  Share or not.  We don't care.  Our voices matter as much as those of anyone else.  Or do they?  Both the members of the Federal Liberal Party and the Provinical NDP often visit this particular publicly funded healthcare institution.  Why?  Posting a photo of my bff.  Enough of a sympathetic figure?  British immigrant to this country in 1959 but a Canadian citizen now only.

My daughter is a patient here. She was let out on a day 30 minute pass. The staff let her out with someone who’s not family. These people are dangerous in watching people in vulnerable states of life! They called me an hour after she went missing. I said it took you an hour to notice that she was gone?! They said she went with the Auntie! And I asked them does Auntie have a name? No, they don’t have a name for the Auntie. These people should be ashamed of themselves. They need a whole new STAFF!

It is clear this hospital does not try to address the bottlenecks that it has.

You will most definitely wait a minimum of 4 to 6 and usually 8 or more hours even just for the results of a test that they called you in for.

ANYTHING non-lifethreatening you are better off seeing your GP for. Or go to one of the other hospitals in the city. Hopefully the administration of this hospital can stop wasting tax payers money and address its bottlenecks. I unfortunately doubt it.

The ONLY saving grace is the nurses are really nice.

EDIT: I would like to say that I do understand there are many factors to fixing the bottlenecks, I think a "blue seal" like the "red seal" could help fast tract individuals who have healthcare training and education from another country, to be able to work in our Healthcare.

In the states they take a competencies tests then start working, here is a bunch of red tape.

Had a scheduled day surgery and the staff was phenomenal. nurses were so kind and helpful, let me take my time to wake up from the anesthesia and helped me with the tiniest things (even though I could barely talk). I didn't feel they were rushing me out at all. if I need to have surgery again I hope it's here

Went to get a scan done in the evening around 9pm as I got a call last week for to come Sunday at 9pm. So I went in and they had nothing in there system booked. Not sure who I talked with but clearly they are useless and the health care in this city is useless. Rather pay to get this done then drive for no reason at a time I'm usually sleeping to not even have it booked. Horrible, don't think I will go back. Hopefully my health will be okay.

Absolutely amazing experience. The staff in the day surgery department were awesome. Went there for a breast reduction which was my first ever surgery and they helped make me feel so comfy every step of the way. They helped calm my anxiety whenever I felt anxious. Definitely recommend this hospital!!!

It looks nice on the outside, the inside is mediocre and the majority of nurses and technicians there are rather rude and unforgiving with their remarks, plus the front desk lady was a troll too, atleast the men working at the security desk were okay sorta, anyway, I would never recommend this place to any friends or family of mine, it is too risky, I feel unsafe even being there, it smells bad, just sitting in a room by myself and I still feel like I will breathe in some unknown airborne strain of some random disease, anyway, enjoy the photos that are definitely not edited

This is the only hospital that I think is worse then st Boniface

Tale of two urgent care centres 24 hours apart. On May 4th I admitted my mother to Concordia urgent care for vomiting and severe dehydration. From the moment of arrival the triage nurse was empathetic and went above and beyond to help. Despite a busy evening my mom was given a comfortable recliner to sit in, immediately given anti nasua injection by the triage nurse and within 2 hours was given an IV. Within 5 hours my mother was admitted, treated and discharged.

Sadly the next day May 5th I caught whatever she had, but this time I chose to go to Victoria hospital as it’s closer to home. From the moment of arriving it was a severely different experience. The nursing staff seemed annoyed by every patient coming in, I was given nothing to stop my vomiting until after 7 hours I practically had to beg for gravol. I waited 12 hours to finally be seen by a doctor and was not even given a bed but rather placed in a random room that stored medical supplies and given a chair despite not having slept or laid down in 12 hours. What added insult to injury was there was a bed in the hallway outside the room not being used. This is completely unacceptable. While the state of our provinces health care has always been horrendous, it cannot be so vastly different in terms of service from one hospital to another within 24 hours. While some things like staffing, volume of patients, etc cannot be helped, there needs to be empathy and some effort from the staff. Waiting 12 hours to be treated for nausea and dehydration is unacceptable.

I stayed over night for day surgery last week, and wanted to thank all of my nurses very very much.
I regret not asking for all of their names, but specifically want to thank Louie and all of the other nurses working the last Wednesday night/Thursday morning shift.
It felt like I paged my nurses every 5 minutes to help me change my ice pack, get a new blanket or even walk me to the washroom, and they all helped me with ease, only seconds after me pushing the call button.
On top of it being late at night, every need of mine, was met by my nurses, with a smile on their face, full of patience, and a genuine sense that they cared about helping me recover.
I am so very grateful that my first surgery was a safe and carful experience, and honestly wish I could give all of my nurses a hug to thank them personally!
Thank you all, it is much appreciated!!
unbelievable wait hours, even you keep bleeding, nurses are chatting and laughing at times. What a fun place to get treatments. 10 wait hours.

From Admitting to Day Surgery Nursing and Support Staff I had such a positive experience. Even though a very busy department every member of the team was professional,efficient,kind and supportive. I never felt rushed and everything was explained every step of the way. Thank you Dr. Lee and all the surgical team at the Vic. You are the best.

Huge privacy issue and safety risk.

The registration clerks are speak to you through speakers in urgent care .
They repeat all your information through these speakers for the entire waiting room to hear .
Your address ,phone number etc etc .

So I went for Day surgery their 3 days ago and in which I needed to stay overnight, wow let me tell you the moment that I walked into that word I felt so comfortable, the nurses were truly the most caring people I’ve ever sat with, the ones taking me to the operating room were so friendly and talked with me about my cat which I loved, once I got out I was taken care of so fast, once my call button was hit the ladies and Gentleman were quick to respond to my needs. Even a nurse waited out in the rain for me while I was waiting to be picked up the next morning.

I’m so forever grateful for this hospital and the nursing staff, this was the best hospital experience I’ve ever had !!!!

My wife went in for a CT scan today May 4th 2024 at 11:20 AM. The technician, a dark haired  woman was very unfriendly, did not help my wife, gave her no pillow under her knees, no blanket like usual and was very brusque. No smiles, no comforting talk. Before the scan I told her that my wife was nearly deaf and very uncomfortable with CT scans. That didn’t help. Usually the technicians are smiling, helpful give pillows and cover you with a blanket. Not a pleasant experience for my wife. This woman needs lessons on bedside manners and empathy.A smile goes a long way. CT scans are scary for some people.

Not the worst hospital that I have attended but I have definitely have some major foe paws with how I was treated and what I witnessed. One doctor working the Er for the whole hospital. Which I don't know if that is a common now for our health system.  But definitely short staffed there.

Jackeline the triage nurse in front was very kind and sympathetic and there  seems to be a good monitoring system as far as monitoring peoples vitals in the waiting room.

Native gentlemen that was in the waiting room that had what looked like severe mental health issues was screaming and banging his head while children were present not a very nice environment for children to be witnessing. As well for people who are already under stress because of why they are there for in the first place.

Five security guards at the back and lots of police there and no one intervened at all which was crazy.

There should be a separate mental health facility for situations of that nature.

Once I finally got in to see a doctor for abdominal issues that I was having. He basically wanted to discharge me upon two seconds of talking to me all because my general blood work checked out. Did not want to bother to feel my abdomen for anything out of the ordinary or do any sort of imaging.
After about ten minutes of me advocating for myself he begrudgingly  ordered an abdominal x ray. Even though I know I was well warranted a CT since I have been dealing with issues over a year now.

I continued to have to advocate and he ordered an outpatient colonoscopy. I wanted to see if I had a bladder infection as well and he told me.. ok... I can call you with the results... what?????

I refused to leave until I had them. Turns out I had a mild infection.

I Asked if I could get a copy of the stuff that was done so I can take it to my family doctor and they refused and said I have to go through medial records. They said it was against their policy to do that. "Even though I got dozens of records before at other hospitals I went to.

I Asked if I could get a pelvic exam due to my symptoms and was refused, as well and tumor marker testing and was also refused.

Horrible experience left crying and upset. Felt unheard dismissed and not listened too after twelve long hour wait.

If you suspect you have cancer and want help. Would highly not recommend coming here. No compassion  just want  to kick you out ASAP is the vibe.

I've been to VGH's urgent care in at least three different occasions. There is never less than and 6-8 hour wait. The place looks and feels dirty, even though they say they put patients in order of risk I've seen pregnant women with bleeding go after kids with that for all intents and purposes were running around like nothing was wrong. And after you pass the waiting room you still have to wait at least an hour for the doctor to come see you. One time I even overheard the nurses saying that they only had one doctor on duty for everyone. This time there were 7 people in the waiting room and nobody has been called into a room for almost 2 hours. There is no water unless you are willing to buy it from the vending machine and if you drive here you will need to pay for parking. If you can find a spot in front of the urgent care, that is. Last time we waited for 6 hours to be called into a room just to wait another hour or so for the doctor to see my wife. He then proceeds to talk to her the a solid 2 minutes, order an ultrasound that the hospital scheduled for over two weeks later and disappears into the night. I will never be coming here again. Not even dragged. I rather drive three times farther away from my house to go to Grace, HSC, or St. Boniface. Don't waste your time in this dump. I am from a third world country and this kind of service is deplorable even by our standards. Of all the reasons to love Canada this kind of pathetic  healthcare service is the one thing I hate.

EDIT 1: It took them 6:20 hours to get us out of the waiting are and into a room. After that, another hours and a half, give or take, for the doctor to come see us (I had to go and complain that we were in the room for over an hour with no one even talking to us). We were told my wife needed an ultrasound but because it was 6 in the morning we had to wait until 8 when the techs would arrive.
Comes 8 AM and nothing, comes 8:30 and still nothing so I go ask and it seems they will fit us when they have the time. Which means it could be at 11:30 AM or it could be never. We remain waiting. 12 hours and counting.

P. S. :This is ridiculous we are occupying a room that could go to someone else if they just did the ultrasound and passed it on to the doctor.

The wait was about 8 hours long. The waiting room was full. The triage nurses are really nice and do check up on you once and a while. I give my nurse Anne Marie a 5 star. She is very kind and compassionate. She is very professional and takes the time to make sure your Ok or feeling better. What blew me away is that she speaks French as well. It made it easier for me to explain what kind of pain I was having and my symptoms. The doctor was very professional and kind as well.
I would definitely recommend if you don't mind waiting.

Absolutely terrible service in the urgent care. Avoid this hospital at all costs they don't care for their patients at all. I used to blame the government for our health care problems but after visiting the urgent care at the Victoria hospital I now believe Doctors and Nurses are equally to blame. Better off going to any other hospital the wait times are always long everywhere but at least you'll be treated like a human being at other hospitals.
Was anxious coming in but the nurses, surgeons, and medical staff were very welcoming. They went above and beyond to make sure I felt taken care of. Thank you guys <3

Very satisfied from my recent visit to the urgent care, the wait time was long however the staff were attentive in the wait room to everyone making sure needs were met! I was very nervous going to urgent care for my issue and the female practitioner kept me at ease the whole time and made sure I was comfortable as the procedure took place. She did an excellent job as-well as the nurse! Thank you guys!!!

Thankyou so much for your care  last night especially the resident doctor. Thankyou for kindness , respect and exceptional care. You are a very special person with a real gift for working with patients
Thankyou to the nurses that cared for me.   Bless you all.

Had day surgery at the Vic and received such great care. I was really impressed by everyone I had contact with. The nurses were so kind and the amount of effort and care they put into their work is commendable.

I can't say enough good things about my recent experience with the staff and facility at VGH. from start to finish it was top notch. The nurses were really exceptional. The aides were awesome and very professional and the doctors were great as well. Great communication all around and everything was triple checked or more. They were also very helpful with other patients who were a bit more complex than I was. I noticed a few of the seniors were in need of some extra care and they got it right away without asking. The nurses also caught a few things like people who had eaten before surgery and some other small things that really stood out to me. I own medical clinics and a pharmacy and would be proud to work with any of the staff I was around yesterday.
The facility itself looked very clean and nicely maintained. I'm sure the staff know of a few things it's actually in need of but everything I saw was working and clean.
I know we rarely get to choose which hospital we want for stuff like surgery in Canada but if I could I would choose VGH every time! If you get the staff I had then you're in for a nice, calm experience with incredible nurses, doctors and the important but often forgotten support staff!
Hats off to VGH!

I was brought in by emergency. I was put in a bed in triage immediately and nurses made sure my pain management was under control. The hospital was very clean. All members of staff were friendly and made sure all my needs were met and made sure I was comfortable for my 8 hour wait.

Went in for day surgery. Very impressed with all the care put into making sure I was comfortable and informed about surgery and aftercare. Every nurse and doctor I saw had a smile and helped me relax about a surgery was stressed about. Thank you to all the staff!!!

Thank you so much to the nurse that booked us in, the doctor that helped my son and the other nurse that brought him a popsicle. He tested positive for COVID and we were offered the most helpful assistance. Thank you so much!

These wait times are a joke. NdP has done nothing like expected

* UPDATE*  SORRY BUT WHEN A NURSE TELLS YOU NOT TO COME IN DUE TO THE WAIT WILL TAKE YOU INTO THE FOLLOWING DAY AND ITS ONLY 745AM IN THE MORNING< THIS HAS BEEN AN ISSUE FOR A LONG TIME

I had a positive experience when visiting for a colonoscopy last week. The admitting staff and all staff in the endoscopy ward were very warm and friendly. It was a comfortable and painless procedure and I felt well looked-after.

My only issue is that the first IV insertion attempt was extremely painful and is still very sore and bruised almost a week later. The second attempt on the other side was more reasonable and has healed completely.

This is my first time on the mental health ward. I have been to others however they pale in comparison to this one. The nurses and staff go above and beyond and are so caring. They will give you your time and just make this a wonderful experience. I have already had some good long talks with the nurses and it’s like talking to a good friend. I feel valued, cared for and I feel like not a patient in a hospital but more like a comfortable recovery place. I highly recommend Victoria and all the nurses and staff should be given praise for their hard work and dedication

My nurse and the rest of the staff was great but the KITCHEN is terrible. They forgot SIX meals for dinner to recovering patients so all six of us went hungry with the exception of cookies and soup. The nurses called 5x, and paged the kitchen with no ansewer. Good nutrition is key to the healing process. According to the nurses it's not the first time that happened.

Great care I had a true medical emergency and it was treated as such..no wait time whatsoever.
Doctor was great but the nurses attitudes are something to be desired.

Don't go here unless you want to die.

Call lights go unanswered for 15-20 minutes. Everytime of the day I'm there it was the same long waits, even at nights. Multiple data points at different times of the day will illustrate a trend. Patients are suffering because of this. A critical incident will happen one day because a patient will try to get hold of staff and staff are inattentive in the hallway charting and chatting while call lights are blaring around them. Charting is important but patient care is more important.

Patients soiling themselves in bed because nobody answers lights to help them. My father calling me at 2am in pain and I'm having to call the front desk from home because he pressed the light and nobody is answering in a reasonable time.

Staff ignoring call lights as if it's someone's else problem, every staff member should be taught to check out a call light not walk past them this includes nurses not just HCAs. Terrible training on the unit. Everyone is fixated on their own tasks they forget the #1 job, care for the patient. Meal trays need to be handed out but if someone is in pain or need to use the commode, the  meal trays can wait, triage!

5 patients in a 4 patient room, no proper call light or privacy for the 5th person jammed in the middle of the room exposing themselves to all who walk in. Also further creating a falls  risk in a room filled with high-falls risk patients.

No attention to basic patient hygiene such as daily oral care or even changing dirty gowns.

No attention to rehabilitation and getting patients stronger and walking. Everyday patients stay in bed they become more and more deconditioned making rehabilitation even harder. Research shows this!

Staff telling patients that they are wearing a brief and they can soil themselves in the brief and will be cleaned up later, how degrading! All the patient needed was a commode or a walk to the bathroom.

Patients advocacy, nurse manager and CEO who don't care and just brush it off saying their hands are tied and there is no funding. How about interfacility transfer if you can't handle the patient load you got and find a bed available for them elsewhere versus lack of care here? We flew patients out of province during covid costing tens of thousands of dollars yet they fail to look at resources across the city. Just laziness and lack of care and patients suffering.

The place is a terrible facility and should be avoided. Picture and videos of situations will be made available to media upon request and on this review page shortly

i suffer from severe cptsd and ptsd and voluntarily checked myself into the psych ward after an attempted suicide and lack of help in selkirk. i spent 6 nights there and left due to being told the only option dr y could offer me was more drugs to make me sleep thru the noisy nights.

my first roomate snored and made other noises thru the night and part of my cptsd is heightened noise sensitivity. she also was generally disrespectful during the day too. after 5 nights with the first roomate and being unable to sleep, my mental health deteriorated quickly. my nurse, jess, was able to move me to another room, saying there were no noise issues with the new roomate. which was not true. i only spent one night and due to her speaking on the phone and snoring lightly and making other noises, i was unable to sleep. there was also a washroom in the new room and the roomate would flush it while the door was open at any hour, like 3:45am, after NOT washing her hands. the flushing was extremely loud and thus while i had managed to doze off due to exhaustion at around 1:30-2am, i was awoken less than 2 hours later. * i am well aware of my noise sensitivity and thus sleep with headphones or earplugs and when it is very noisy i will listen to music.

aside from the roomate and noise issues, the dr i was assigned (dr doron yehudaiff) was NOT very professional: he not only criticized my showing emotions when speaking and reliving trauma, he then critcized me for expressing why i had trepidation and fears bcuz i shared what has happened to me from so-called health professionals in the past. as i am a first nations woman in canada, i have been greatly mistreated and disrespected bcuz ppl think i'm some sort of savage idiot. meanwhile i have 8 yrs of uni with 2 b.a.'s and have done 5+ yrs of therapy. including 2 yrs of cbt therapy to help manage my cptsd.

i only met with him 3 times and he criticized me twice on the first meeting, after my first night. the second meeting was the morning of dec 24 and dr yehudaiff seemed much more concerned with getting the meeting over quickity-split so he could leave, he didn't even bring his books or notes. i felt like he was annoyed with having to meet me and wanted to rush me out the door. the meeting lasted less than 5 mins.

the 3rd meeting was jan 2 after i had not slept more than 10 hours over 5 nights, and i was in a mental health crisis. he told me my only option was to take more drugs to knock me out so i would be dead to the world (and anyone could do anything to me and i wouldn't know).  when i repeated this back to him a few minutes later, he gaslit me and said it wasn't my only option, that i could learn to manage the situation.

so, this genius dr figured after 50 years of not sleeping more than 4-6 hours a night due to trauma and abuse, i could learn to manage sleeping in close quarters with a roomate who made noise. and never washed her hands after using the toilet.

when i mentioned the 2 criticisms he had made if me, and how it was disrespectful, he gave me the usual response that ppl think absolve themselves of being disrespectful: "it wasn't my intention". frankly it matters not if it wasn't his intention or that he didn't understand how he was being disrespectful, all that matters is that he was disrespectful. i ended up by asking to be transferred to another facility or to get another dr and he said he could not do that.

so. if you have a mental health crisis and are sent to the victoria hospital, and end up with a dr who gaslights you and with whom you don't get along, you're stuck in a situation that won't help you. thankfully i was there voluntarily.

long story short, i checked myself out bcuz i was being triggered into having cptsd attacks by my dr and the situation, and my cptsd attacks make me want to end my life. which is how i ended up there in the first place.

thankfully, i made it through the night, i finally got some sleep and am a bit rested so i am now looking to go to another hospital or mental health facility before i try to end my life again.

Hello, because I watched the Sailing Nahoa YouTube blogger's video of giving birth, I want to choose your hospital to receive help. Also, I would like to know who the doctor in the picture is and her contact information because I want to contact you. Sailing Nahoa accepts the same doctor's help, is it okay? Please, thank you.

Having recently gone to urgent care, as much as I didn't like the long wait, I did expect it.
I understand the nurses and doctors are quite busy and have full respect for them.
However, I do not appreciate the tone and words spoken to me by 1 nurse, I didn't catch her name.
I was given instructions on what I should do if the medication prescribed did not work, from the nurse I had seen while I was at the hospital.
However, the nurse on the phone had no patience and spoke rudely to me.
Rather than politely apologizing for incorrect information given to me, or nicely explaining, I was told 'no, you're wrong', followed up by her hanging up the phone.

I have never written a review about such experience, but this bothered me as I am in pain and rather than support, the nurse was just rude.
I will not be going to Victoria Hospital going forward.

Saturday night I mis-stepped at the side of our neighbours house! I broke my right foot in two places. I was seen very promptly! Everyone from admitting, triage, the nurses, doctor and the x-ray technician were absolutely great! In particular RJ from the x-ray department was careful not to hurt me when giving me a few x-rays, bedside manner was amazing, very thorough and prompt, and even made me laugh to forget about my pain!! I highly recommend this hospital if you’re in need of medical service.

Supposed to go to the hospital for help
For lots of people it takes a lot of courage to go to the urgent care even when there hurt or sick .
Then u get to the urgent care an your met with rude ,unpleasant care from the nurses to the doctors .
(Avoid this hospital)

If you value the life of your loved ones go els where vic is the reason my father is in a coma at st boniface he was admitted with symptoms of a heart attack they gave him medication for indigestion and discharged him for the security to find him out in the parking just to be put back in the waiting room to gather his information again while he couldn't even talk. So please if you value the life and health of your loved ones go els where

I wanted to take the time to leave a review after my stay here. My condition is not a common one- despite this, I felt very accommodated in the short time I spent here! While I can't remember everyone's name(there were quite a few!), I'd like to extend my deepest gratitude to all of the nurses, surgeons, and everyone else who cared for me yesterday; as I didn't have the chance to thank everyone before I left.

Everyone there was very busy but still took the time to check on me regularly, bringing me medicine, checking my blood pressure, keeping an eye out for signs of infection, bleeding, etc. I hope everyone there knows they have truly made a difference in my life. Keep being great!

Worst experiences ever at this hospital! It’s basically a big walk in clinic! Doctors don’t care and are arrogant towards their patients. You wait hours on end for them to just treat you like garbage. If you can take the extra 15 min drive to st boniface do it! Don’t come here

I was impressed by the staff at urgent care. It is really unfortunate what they have had to go through with understaffing and I really sympathize with them. Sure it was a long wait but the doctor thoroughly tried to figure out what was wrong, and the nurses were patient and friendly. Thankfully the treatment prescribed helped a lot. Just wanted to thank the hospital, the doctor and nurses.

I had my gallbladder out last spring, and while the surgeon was apparently unaware I couldn't have tylenol and had prescribed it despite all the forms I'd filled out before, the nurses were helpful with finding a solution. Then the after surgery care in recovery was excellent. I really felt cared for as they were very careful to make sure I was well enough to go home, didnt try to rush me  into walking when I was dizzy, checked on me probably every 15 minutes etc.. It was my first surgery, and I was understandably nervous, so I really appreciated the care and time they took. I think I was in recovery for maybe 7 hours (unsure because of course I don't know when I got there). I felt safe and well looked after the entire time. I know staff is stressed and overworked due to covid, but I didn't sense any of that when I was there. Thank you!

This is a disgusting place to visit. They made me wait for 7 hrs just for one painkiller. This is what you call an emergency? Why people come to your hospitals because they want you guys to treat them with care. But ooh no, Triage nurse area is so busy in sharing their personal life with their co workers. I went their at 4:30 and my turn came at 11pm. Seriously!! Even though before me, there were only 7 patients in line and still it took them 7 hrs. And when you got your you will see the doctors and nurses are sitting at the counter inside area. Which makes me think why there was hell of long wait for 7 hrs.

Thank you kindly to the Colonoscopy Department. The team was very kind and professional. No pain or discomfort. I forgot to bring something to read and I waited nearly 2 hours for my scheduled exam. Please bring something to read. Except for that, everything else was excellent! Thank you once again!

I have been to this hospital twice for emergency at night with my teenage boys at different times. The nurses there were absolutely horrible with my kids. They treated us like an inconvenience and showed little care for my kids. When we complained about care they moved us to a room further away from the nurses station. I feel like the nurses there hate their jobs and show this with little empathy for their patients. Would recommend you go anywhere else. Horrible care at this hospital for emergency issues.

Honestly I wish I could give 5 stars. The whole experience was phenomenal until the very end of our stay. All the nurses and Drs were phenomenal minus one. Robyn, a RN in urgent care who clearly was having a bad day and wanted to make it known. If it weren’t for her bedside manner being horrendous, I’d have given a 5 star google review.

Worst experience in a hospital ever while waiting for a bed in the emergency waiting room I just wanted an update so I could know how long it might be, the nurses where busy of course but they did not want to even give me a response and where incredibly rude, when I was in so much pain I could no longer sit I asked the nurse if it was possible for me to even lie down in the corner with zero empathy the nurse said “absolutely not” I then walked out and went to st boniface where they were so kind and considerate. I hope the pregnant nurse that was incredibly rude gets the same treatment when she goes into labour.. I get it’s a tough job especially right now but no one deserves such inhumane treatment.

Nurses and Doctors are amazing! People normally comment or rate when they have bad experiences. But this time I only have good words for them! Their service is amazing, they are kind and sweet. The queues and waiting times are not because of them, they are because of the system. Thanks Victoria Hospital!

I would like to thank Dr. Laura Chan and all the staff in Admitting, Day surgery and recovery.  Everyone was friendly, knowledgable and supportive during my stay. Thank you for your continued hard work in the Healthcare field during these stressful times.

Generally the hospital is good but on a recent stay  beginning of December I was shocked to hear the attitude of a male nurse to an elderly agitated or confused patient.

I was in the section waiting for a bed in main hospital. The male was extremely patronizing with the lady and while escorting her I over heard him tell her to hurry up and not walk so slow . Seems he was almost encouraging an argument. Afterwards I pointed this out to another male nurse and was more or less told mind my own business and if I didn’t actually see the incident I should be quiet. I also got the impression that this is not the first time there was an incident with the first male nurse . Seems he was covering a regular staff member so she could attend an outside business matter.

Hope I won’t have to stay there again!!

Worst Tiagre nurses ever seen in whole world they are for help not to judge patients personally.
They are nurses no doctors who can tell that you are not in pain, the patient who is waiting since more than 8hrs in emergency is not crazy to sit there without pain. Specially when he is been waiting for major surgery from last 9 months.
Department should consider this problem seriously we pay taxes not for this.
If possible I should give -5 Star for this.
Hopelessly Hopeless Tiagre Nurses and there behaviors.

Most of the triage nurses are insensitive, self-involved, unsympathetic millenials.  The doctors are either wonderful and helpful or abusive.   The facility and urgent care managers are NOT willing to partner on a proper care plan, even with supportive documents from a specialists.   Go if you have a minor complaint, stay away if you're at risk for stroke or other adverse events.  You might die in their "care."

OMG, very worse experience!! Waited in the emergency for more than 6 hours from 6 pm to 1 am. I was told to wait again as they have no idea when they can get me in. WEIRD😕! The evening triage nurse was polite but the night staff seemed she didn't care at all. She mentioned she cannot say how long the waiting time so I was forced to leave the emergency due to my sickness.
If you want proper care and treatment please choose any other hospitals even if it is far from your place.
I am not the only person left the emergency because of their ignorance.
Very bad staff and hospital. Instead of putting the estimated waiting time is 5+ hours the hospital authorities can update unlimited waiting time. Inform your patients as soon as possible so they will get an opportunity to go to the next hospital which has less waiting time.

I went in for a hiatus hernia repair yesterday. I've been through procedures before. I know how the process looks from time of enter to going home after surgery. The Staff makes the place hum they're a fantastic smooth operation bunch picked from a golden tree. I've received super care and a fantastic doctor. Excellent experience coming from me someone who knows what to expect. 5 star well deserved. Keep up the great atmosphere guys.
Thanks.

I found this so-called all-day hospital because of unbearable pain on weekends.
The front desk asked me about my symptoms and made me wait for three hours.
The doctor took me in and told me that there was nothing that could be done about this symptom, then he drew my blood, and mailed me a bill for $1,000

Head injury,
Fully covered with blood ,, still have to wait for 12hours in emergency,, then get 9 stitches on head

Had the worst experience in the emergency last night (Oct 19, 2022). We came in around 9:30 and the initial wait time was about 3 hours to see a doctor. After 3 hours, the triage nurse says the wait time will be 7 hours. After waited for 8 hours, the nurse says there won’t be doctor available till morning around 8:00-9:00 am. Means it will be 12 hours wait time. Also, it’s not guarantee to see a doctor after 12 hours.

I came to emergency because of my prescription drugs no long working and I suffered from serious stomach pain for 24 hours. But I’m end end, I wasn’t able to see a doctor.

I was very disappointed!!

Ive gone to Victoria Hospital Urgent Care 3 times. Will NOT GO AGAIN!! Six hours wait to see a dr and another 4 hours for lab work!!???? The waiting room has  the waiting patients facing the office workers?? rather than face the window or anything else for that matter.
MIsercordia Hospital urgent care was MUCH BETTER! They would have patients sign a book when walking in so you know they have your name and know you are there and  then you would get called to triage. Not so at Victoria urgent care. You are met at the door and instructed to put on a mask and sit down. How do the triage staff know you are there or know what order patients have arrived or even know if your problem could be life threatening?Victoria "Urgent" care??? I think not. There is huge room for improvement here!

If I could put a 0 rating I would.  Not all but most of the staff have no compassion, rude and when the staff is being aggressive with you when you are trying to get answers and you respond in the same tone as them you are suddenly told to leave or walk out as they did to me and I kept telling the person to slow down as I have a neurological condition and use a walker and she was walking so fast, and she told me she didn't care she wanted me out of the hospital because I had upset her staff how I don't know seeing as I was doing their job for them as they all stood around talking about non medical things such as holidays, things their family like and don't like etc.  They are the most unprofessional and hide behind their Union Status, because they know they will not be written up anyway, nor any discipline action will be taken unlike those of us who if we behaved like that in a Non Union environment would be fired for.  The signs of aggressive and rude behavior is a two way street and they don't seem to get that, it only applies to them not an advocate for the patient or to the patient themselves.  My mom went in 4 months ago a strong fairly independent person who is now the most confused and unrecognizable person mentally I have ever seen, it just breaks my heart at what they have done to her.  I am now working on getting her out of there as dying at home would be kinder than the way they treat the elderly there.   Do not take an elderly patient there or allow another hospital to transfer them there.  Unless you want them to die a slow and painful death.  And good luck trying to talk to anyone as they just brush you off as your concerns don't amount to anything.  And too just an FYI playing a movie on YouTube like one nurse was one day I walked by her desk while people who needed help as you hear all these bells going off and she was just sitting there ignoring them very unprofessional . As an ex IT worker  it makes me wonder how secure their computers are if you can access You Tube while being on a medical computer, how secure is there server system?  Food for thought if the hospital even reads their reviews.  I have never been so turned off especially with what happened today but that is another story and one I will if need be bring up in some form to either the Minster of Health or maybe the press as the Social Worker was way out of line today and again very rude, condescending, and unprofessional.  Telling me my mom doesn't want to see me when I go every day having paid already $1000,00 in 4 months to park there just so I make sure she eats there slop they call food sadly half the time she won't eat it as it is so bad and she is losing weight and muscle tone as the days go by and also is not being looked after properly, most days I find her in bed hence why she lost all of her muscle mass. Which obviously from my review you know she is not, nor is any other patient really as I have gotten to know most of them because I help them too as best I can even though I myself am not in the best of health.

Went into urgent care today & the amount of time I waited was very reasonable. The wait time wasn't long at all. The screener at the door & the employees at the front desk were very kind. The doctor & the nurse who treated me were also very calm and kind and answered all my questions. The environment and the staff were very professional and provided great service.
Thank you very, very much.

Long waits. Went in thinking I was having a miscarriage ladies were friendly at the triage desk. I had to wait over 5 hours for a room any another hour for the doctor. I thought I was having a miscarriage and I thought they would see me a little quicker. Thankfully my baby was fine but if I was in an active miscarriage it would have happened in the waiting room. They said "we don't deal with child birth here" that's understandable but I'm not in labour and you are the closest hospital to me. They had all the equipment and knowledgeable staff to care for a pregnant woman.

I've experienced the worst Emergency /Urgent care services ever... Came here 15 weeks pregnant with bleeding... Already waiting for  4 hrs... They keep holding me here with no help or medical  professional services provided... This is so frustrating and dissapointing. This place is a disaster place to be in case some urgent care needed. Was my 1st and last time to be there. Don't waste yr time. Safe yourself. :(((((((
Useless hospital. Can hear the staff gossiping and giggling in the back while they have people bleeding in their waiting room. Unbelievable.

almost amputated my left thumb doing chores my wife wanted me to do,  drove to urgent care.  since I was holding my thumb on the security guard helped me get out my health card etc.  triage offered painkillers, was put to secondary within 20 minutes. the ER doctor sewed it back on about 20 minutes after that,  then I had to wait for some antibiotics.  staff was nice,  socially distanced seating,  free wifi,  clean bathrooms.  this place has it all.  highly recommend for your next medical emergency. total visit including triage less than 2 hours

I was in overnight for day surgery. Impressed with front line staff, the docs, nurse, aids. Everyone seemed happy to be there and I only had positive encounters, great attitudes and any questions I had were answered. The OR TEAM works like a well oiled machine! Super impressed. Thank you Dr. Botkin, OR TEAM, my nurses and aids.
Michelle (April 6,2022)

I had wonderful and positive experience. I never need to go to the emergency room. Yesterday I did and the experience was great. So many helpful, considerate and competent people and they were all helping me. I think given the reality of health care it can be a crap shoot as to whether you'll wait or not. I had only a brief wait, five hours of care and I was on my way. Thank you Vic emergency room staff . I'd give you ten stars if I could.

Every time I've had a serious emergency, I've gotten a bed as quickly as possible. The place is clearly hamstrung by past Conservative policies, though there is occasionally someone with a truly, horrible, careless bedside manner and that has no excuse. But those folks are in the minority among the decent health care workers here.

However, my favorite Doctor in the city works in this Urgent Care **shout-out to Dr. Hitchcock -- he actually listens.

Second time I have come to this hospital and both times I have walked out. Just the waiting times are atrocious. Is 6 hours waiting to see a doctor acceptable when I only needed a maximum of 2-3 minutes with a doctor to assess me.

I can get better service in 3rd world countries than in 'canada'. I hope that this hospital burns down. Then maybe the PC government can buy a facility 3 times it size and staff it with 1000x more people.

I won't be coming back to this shit°ole ever.

Went to Urgent care with some sharp pains which ended up to be an appendicitis and ended up with energy surgery . Waiting time was little longer but not terrible ( about 3 hrs ) considering we're still in Covid 19 situation . From Urgent care , to pre and post surgery , every person that took care of me was so caring, compassionate, friendly and had a smile on their faces . I so very thankful to every and each staff, nurse and the doctor ❤

The doctor that works in the urgent care Dr. Korshen (didn't catch her full name, its long and she looks East Indian) should not be working there. I came in for chest pain, heart palpitations and she sends me home to rest.  She is also very rude, doesn't listen and kept talking over me. I got a better treatment from the triage nurse than this so called doctor. This doctor should first learn some compassion skills before treating anyone else.

My wife brought me to the doctor for an infection in my leg. Told us he'd feel better if we went to The Vic for IV antibiotics. Was sent along with a note outlining how serious the infection was. We  waited a total of 8 hours to even see a nurse. This nurse was UNBELIEVABLY rude. She talked to both my wife and I like we were children, didn't ask much information, just assumed everything. I swear, if my life was on the line I'd never go back to The Vic. Triage,nurses,covid screeners(well 1 of 2) all just super rude and unprofessional.  Only thing you did for me was to prove the stories I've heard right. Thanks for nothing! Warning to all, if you use The Vic Urgent Care and get a nurse name Becky, RUN!

Daughter went for a post surgery infection and was treated like garbage by the triage nurse.   Made to feel like she was faking it.   Such a long wait.   Seems like third world health care treatment is better.

I give this a 5 star simply compared to hsc(worst, and some of the population that walks around outside are undesirable ), st boniface (a little) and Concordia (on par with st b)   Had a 12 hour wait but was actually admitted and treated properly.  The other 3 places just sent me home without really addressing the issue.
I was in on December 21/22 for surgery. The Doctors, Nurses and all the staff made it a great experience. Very professional, compassionate and great senses of humor which helped put me at ease.

Whoever answers phones in oncology needs to go for sensitivity training. No empathy, no willingness to help. Infact, she point blank told me ‘I can’t help you. You will have to find help elsewhere’, even though I offered to pay out of pocket. That person should not be talking to patients in any capacity, period!

I had to take my daughter in on the 6th of June. Yes we waited for a few hours but it was worth it!. My daughter received a complete workup. Our Physician Assistant was so thorough. He eased our minds and we left there with a feeling of comfort. Keep doing what you are doing Vic. I am very impressed.
Some of the night shift nurses are not very nice. Most of the day shift nurses are very good to work with. I recommend going during the day

Worst service I’ve ever received.
My recommendation is not to go there.
Long waiting time.
Nurses at the front are nice though but once you get inside, no one knows when you would be able to see doctor.
If you get sick then it’s your mistake. Don’t get sick don’t waste their time. It’s better to die at home rather than in a hospital.

If it says that waiting time 5+ hours, it actually 14+ hours. It is definitely not an emergency and something must be changed in order to help people not to die waiting for help. No complaint against doctors or nurses, they are professional.

There are times when their medical workers don't stop good citizens from Mental Health problems like I was there for attempted suicide plans but didn't do anything except questions and answers to fish for information only as my last day allowance there. My last breath is inspite of sleep there few minutes in progress as designed. Otherwise I can not complain about them.

My boyfriend woke up yesterday morning with severe pain and burning in his stomach that was so bad he went to urgent care. He chose Victoria hospital because they had the shortest wait time and he needed assistance fast. They claimed there was nothing alarming from his X-ray, blood, or pee. After giving him pain medication + a muscle relaxer shot they determined his abdomen must’ve been strained from working out.

At 6 pm the pain got worse and I called for an ambulance that brought him back to Victoria hospital. After several hours of waiting in the room and only being given T3’s + another shot they discharged him saying he would be okay and that he should just relax at home. They explained if it was really serious he wouldn’t be responsive to the pain medication. This was frustrating to hear because his family and I knew there was something else wrong.

Once he got home he was unable to eat or drink without experiencing immediate pain/bloating and was vomiting constantly. He was extremely restless and FOR A THIRD TIME admitted himself into a hospital-- this time at Seven Oaks. They did the CT scan that Victoria hospital thought wasn’t necessary and found out he has a bowel obstruction. He is currently waiting for his covid test results, so that he can be rushed into surgery at Grace hospital.

I don’t know what else to say except trust your gut and keep asking for help even if they think nothing is wrong. I don’t know what could’ve happened to him if he chose to listen to Victoria hospitals advice and just tried to relax at home. This was a horrible experience for my boyfriend and unfortunately a review like mine won’t stop it from happening again.

I am just so ANGRY! I waited 5 hours in urgent care with extreme pain in my neck, something I had in the past that I KNEW what it was leading up to. Finally was taken into the back to be seen by a nurse who gave me a prescription for nothing useful....NOW I HAVE BELL'S PALSY!! THIS IS THE SECOND TIME I NOW HAVE TO GO THROUGH WITH THIS PAINFUL CONDITION! START LISTENING TO YOUR PATIENTS!!

Thankfully a walk-in clinic near where I live actually took me seriously and prescribed what I needed.

Some of the drs seem to care and do a good job but ive been dealing with lumps in my neck for the past cpl years atleast i went for multiple scans at victoria hospital being told nothing is wrong i got a new family dr who us really good and she sent me for a ultra sound and i had 2 swollen lymph nodes over 1cm which my dr told me a biopsy should have been done so they send me for another scan and one of the male drs at victoria hospital told me nothing is wrong even tho the swollen lymph nodes showed up im constanlty in pain and having numbness my dr listens but victoria hospital just keeps sending me home with out telling me any information from my scans or blood work i asked the dr why my lymph nodes are swollen from my ultra sound i had else where and he said he didnt kno and that id be fine and it would go away so i leave my dr calls a few days later to tell me i had a low white blood cell count and that the lymph nodes had gotten bigger and non of this was told to me at victoria hospital fast forward to now i now have 5 lumps in my neck that feel the same size or bigger then the previous lymph nodes and still nothing being done i asked for a biopsy multiple times cause just to confirm if its cancer ir not so i get the right help but i keep getting sent home i feel im gonna die soon if i dont get the right help i need

Went into urgent care and from the person at the front door, the Registration Clerk to the Triage Nurse. Everyone was polite,proffesional and very Caring!! Thank you all for what you do and what youve been through in the past few years!!

I had surgery on October 18, 2019. I can’t say enough good comments about the staff, the anesthetist, Dr. Barker, and ALL the nurses. I didn’t get the feeling that they were there just for the paycheques not for the patients. I have been to many hospitals and they could learn a lot on how to treat patients from the staff at Victoria Hospital. Thank you all very much.

From Irene Graham
Kenora, Ontario

It was horrific, I was there a few months ago for pooping blood. I waited NINE hours then had to go back the next day for results.
I was there again September 18/19 because I hit  My head after the power went …

“Nurses and doctors r busy” they always say that. Long hours of waiting but actually theres no staffs at all to help with the patients need, they will just make us WAIT until doctors show up to work !. It’s ridiculous how I paid my tax for this. :(((

The best staff in the city!! Check in is pleasant.  Often there are colouring sheets in the waiting room and if your child is in need of hydration they help you right away with a popsicle.  It is by far my preferred hospital!!!  The student doctors are also very personable and the NPR are also very knowledgeable!
I’m still alive after 28 years. They did a good job.
Mother in law (80 yrs old) was involved in a major accident & was transported to Victoria Hospital for treatment. Waited 5+ hours.... unacceptable!!!!

I’ve been hospitalized 2x at the Vic, once recently in the Covid 1st wave. The staff, taxed as they are, working under the constant threat of exposure to Covid, provided exemplary care. On a daily basis each nurse I was assigned to - took the time to engage me in conversation, assess my well-being with vitals and my verbal responses. The food is hospital food, come on folks... and the wait times are never as short as we want but it’s the fault of the systemic underfunding and not the people!! Thanks for a great job!

Waiting time is very high. Went with my wife with some vaginal bleeding with high blood pressure. They did not do any test. Just kept us waiting and sent us home while her pressure was still high. But then we went to St. Boniface hospital where service was much better. They monitored her pressure in 30 min interval and took inside within one hour. However, she had a miscarriage. I won't go to Victoria hospital again for this kind of issues and won't reccomend anyone since I believe we could have saved the festus if we went to St. Boniface first

This hospital is a joke. Had to take my sister in emergency, waited for 1 hour 15 minutes. They gave her food of the wrong patient so had to cancel ultrasound the same day. They told her not to eat or drink the next day for ultrasound. We waited until 2pm still no call we tried calling the hospital no response, finally we got a call back saying they have severe emergency cases so they can’t do her ultrasound and she will have to wait for a week. Wow!!
By all means do not take any loved one to this place. They are severely under staffed and you and loved ones will sit rotting in a room for hours on end due to lack of staff.

The Oncology nurses are amazing and caring.  The doctors that the time to explain things to me.  I would give it 5 stars if it weren't for the rude clerks Kavita and another lady with an Indian accent.  They are absolutely are miserable and shouldn't be working there if they can't treat patients with respect.

My daughter was born here and my son was born at the women's, The Victoria hands on a way better hospital, so friendly and profesional , and very caring and loving and clean. The nurses are there to assist you.
Despite one nurse who was so old school, with newborns, my over all experience was excellent, I loved it here, best hospital in the city.wish they were still delivering babies here cuz i would of loved to have both my children here. The women's hospital kicks you out asap, even though u just gave birth. At the Vic they let me stay till I felt comfortable going home. I love this hospital, plus it's pretty.

I currently have a friend in the hospital there, says she has been there since the beginning of the month & has been treated bad while she's been there....  She believes it's because she is not fully vaxxed. Asked for Lunch today at 12 and nothing yet.....It's passed 3pm now...
I don't know What kind of people do they have working at these hospitals?

Of course not everyone there is bad, but there's always those odd ones you come across..........
Went for a CTSCAN. Got in early, got out early! Staff were very nice and very friendly.very. Nice experience!!

2nd worse hospital I've been to, the Grace Hospital also located in Winnipeg Manitoba is the #1 worst but Victoria has the worst wait times, some of the most rude nurses and workers at the front desk I have ever met in my life. They need to seriously look into their current employees and get rid of these rude and useless nurses who do it for a job and get some people working there that actually want to help people and aren't there just for a paycheck. Would rate zero star if there was an option or even negative star. Thanks for nothing except wasting my time.

By far the worst hospital in Winnipeg. My pregnant girlfriend had a blood clot and the geniuses there gave here medication that was full of alcohol and almost caused a miscarriage. After going back to get the right medicine we were met with hostility and a complete lack of care from each staff member we encountered. No one should ever go and support this hospital. Worst hospital in winnipeg

I spent about 12 hours yesterday (may 10/16) in Victoria’s emergency department. I have nothing but the highest praise for the medical personnel and the care, patience, good humour and kindness with which they looked after me.  I especially appreciated the explanation of my condition I was given by the Doctor who discharged me (Dr.Goulet), as well as our brief conversaton about English Lit  (always nice to meet an honours grad from my old department).

I came to urgent care multiple times last summer and don't get me wrong, the nurses here are amazing and will make sure you're okay and get whatever you need. BUT the specialist you need will 80% most likely not be around and they'll have to send you to St B almost every time.

One of the worst hospitals in Winnipeg. Some (not all) of nursing staff and support staff are extremely rude and uncaring. Too busy talking about their social life at the triage station then caring for a patient is moaning in pain for assistance.

Have also found that you are judged for what health problem you are coming in with by the nursing staff. I had a nurse scoff/chuckle at me for having a severe soar throat with difficulty swallowing.
Never experienced this at any other hospital in Winnipeg.

I just had my surgery at the Victoria hospital, the doctor, nurses and staff are very nice and kind to me, I received really good services, I'm happy with the service they provide even though the nurses and doctors are very very busy but still taking the time to help me and answer my questions, overall I had a really comfortable surgery and good experience with Victoria hospital, if there's one thing I wish for then that is I hope our government can putting more funding into our health care system and hiring more health care workers so the nurses and doctors are not too overworked. 😊

they should atleast keep more doctors seriously its embarassing a big hospital like this makes patients wait for hours i am very dissapointed with the canadian health system i dont recommend you go during the night idk about during the day but during the night expect to stay for atleast 5+ hours

The doctor assistant said we have to wait 2 hours, and we can leave and come back 2 hours later. But when we come back in one hour, the receptionist said we have to re-regist agian and wait 2 hours agin. I already be here for 5 hours. The recepionist that was a student, she did not know the situation, so why I have to take this responsibility? Never meet staffs like this, horrible management in here. I doubt here can manage the patient well.

I was admitted for day surgery on Monday February 1st.
I absolutley have nothing but prasie to pass onto ALL the staff at the VGH.
From my doctor right down to the staff at the COVID station at the front doors, everyone was poliete, positive, helpful, friendly, etc. All of this on a Monday morning is saying a lot about any organization. Lets also don't forget to mention profession.  Everyone made my 9 hr stay strees free. Honestly I felt like royality and I am certain they do their best to make everyone feel the same way.  CUDOS to one and ALL.

Very Sincerly
Bruce Swingle

Thank you to Dr Desilva and Dr Horvath for providing a diagnosis, treatment and understanding of what seems to be a treatable condition. Also thanks to the nursing and support staff
Ed

For a Winnipeg hospital, it was refreshing coming here.  These smaller places don't hold the big reputation like HSC, or st Boniface, but it wasn't nearly as run down, was really clean, and the staff were excellent!  I also didn't feel like I was going to get stabbed or shot in the parking lot
Waited 12+ hour in the emergency unit, worse than 3rd world country hospitals ,lack of doctors, no first aids, not comforting at all.
This is my second time visiting this hospital. 8 hour wait my first time, and horrible service. Feels like a lawless land and felt so unsafe and dirty.

Garbage people work here. You should not call yourselves doctors. I am in huge pain returning from the hospital because you said "we dont know what's wrong" I'm sorry isn't it your job to find out. That's why people go to you! I wanted to know if I could eat after leaving your hospital. I had a salad. You said "eat whatever you like when you leave here". so I did. I wasnt expecting the same excruciating pain as from when I arrived in the morning. You are supposed to have some answers. Nope. You had T3s and Gravol.  Good job. You are about as prepared as my mother.

wouldnt tell me what my bloodwork shows, nurse said that she wasnt allowed to tell me and that only the doctor could "hospital policy"

Had to go for urgent care. Minimal wait time. Polite nurses and knowledgeable physician made this necessity much more pleasant. I was impressed by all.

Best hospital in the city. They may have long wait times on occasion but they manage patient flow well and their times are the best in the city.  The staff is always friendly and treats patients with care and dignity. Would highly recommend this place to all.

If you want to die soon, then you are most welcome here . Came to urgent care but they give their care after three hours . Almost about to faint. Oh! N also. Staffs really don’t know how to behave. They should be the staff of some worst kind of jail!

Great staff and facility... For the complainers that feel they have an entitlement... go to the States its only a couple hours away... maybe shorter than your wait time... and PAY THE BILL.🤔 Unfortunately people need to be educated on what constitutes an emergency and use our health care facilities in an appropriate way. Frustrating seeing people taking up space with a boo boo, or cough... go to the Pharmacy and get a bandaid or cough syrup.

Worst hospital I have ever been to in my life. I had a deep bleeding wound to my finger and I had to wait in the urgent care for over three hours just to get it patched up. I have never waited this much for a cut wound in my life.

Every single person I came into contact with at Victoria Hospital during my day surgery and overnight stay was so sweet. I cannot stress enough how good my experience was there!!

Very warm and polite receptionist at ultrasound dept. Sonologist was very nice and professional.
Hospital is immaculately clean!
